original_text:
Aztec Wilds
Diciamocelo subito, il tema delle civiltà antiche è tra quelli che ha fatto le fortune delle slot machine, per non parlare poi di quello degli Aztechi, civiltà sudamericana avvolta da un alone di mistero anche per via dei sacrifici umani rivolti alle divinità. C’è un altro motivo per cui gli Aztechi sono entrati di diritto nell’immaginario collettivo e questo in virtù della loro ricchezza e dei tesori nascosti che i più grandi esploratori hanno cercato invano nel corso dei secoli.
A differenza di tante altre slot dedicate all’argomento, Aztec Wilds della Iron Dog Studio ha dalla sua una grafica molto curata, come ci ha ormai abituato questa software house nei suoi lavori precedenti, ma anche un sistema di gioco per nulla banale che si discosta dallo schema classico che ritroviamo nella maggior parte delle slot machine.
La griglia di gioco è incorniciata nella pietra e i simboli dai colori sgargianti sono scolpiti su dei massi quadrati. Ai lati si trovano due sculture dalla forma circolare rappresentanti simboli magici che si riveleranno importanti nello svolgimento del gioco. Nella parte sottostante troviamo le impostazioni per aumentare o diminuire la puntata, il tasto per impostare i giri automatici e quello per la rotazione manuale dei rulli. Il comparto musicale, oltre al suono della caduta dei massi, è caratterizzato da musiche tribali con flauti e tamburi.
Caratteristiche principali
La griglia ha cinque rulli e quattro righe, con 1024 modalità di vincita, anche in virtù dei vari moltiplicatori che è possibile attivare durante i Free Spins. L’RTP è pari al 96,2% e ha una volatilità alta. Il range di puntate è compreso tra 0,50 € e 50 € ed è possibile attivare da un minimo di 5 giri automatici sino a un massimo di 999.
Simboli e funzionalità di Aztec Wilds
Tra i simboli che pagano meno ci sono quelli che si riferiscono alle carte da gioco, dal 10 all’Asso, a seguire abbiamo le tre maschere, verde, rossa e blu. I medaglioni d’oro assicurano ottime vincite: con 5 simboli, si va da 150 volte la scommessa sino a 400 volte.
A dare spessore a questa slot sono però i 3 diversi Wild:

Il primo è un normale Wild con funzione di Jolly, può comparire sui rulli 2, 3, 4 e 5 e sostituisce tutti i simboli.
Il secondo Wild è detto “adesivo” e può comparire solo sul rullo 3. Se i simboli sottostanti scompaiono scende di una riga, altrimenti ricopre la funzione normale di Wild.
C’è poi un Wild a espansione che può comparire casualmente sui rulli 2, 3, 4, 5. Occupando tutto il rullo le possibilità di avere combinazioni vincenti cresce a dismisura.

Come detto prima, abbiamo un sistema di simboli a cascata: ogni combinazione vincente fa sparire i simboli interessati, sostituiti da nuovi simboli che potrebbero risultare anch’essi vincenti. Ogni volta che si verifica questo fatto, la scultura accanto alla cornice viene attraversata dalla lava, evidenziandone una parte. Con quattro combinazioni consecutive si attivano i giri gratuiti. Durante i Free Spins, dopo quattro vincite si attiva un moltiplicatore progressivo che può arrivare sino a un massimo di 6X.

raw_translation.response:
Aztec Wilds

Let's face it, the theme of ancient civilizations is one of the most successful in the world of slot machines, especially when it comes to the Aztec civilization. This South American culture shrouded in mystery due to their human sacrifices to the gods, has long been the stuff of legends. But there is another reason why the Aztecs have captured the imagination of so many - their wealth and hidden treasures that the greatest explorers have sought in vain for centuries.

Unlike many other slots dedicated to this topic, Iron Dog Studio's Aztec Wilds has a highly polished graphics standard, as we have come to expect from this software house in its previous works. Moreover, its gameplay system is far from the standard, with unique features that distinguish it from the majority of slots.

The game grid is framed in stone, and the brightly colored symbols are etched onto square rocks. On either side are two circular-shaped sculptures representing magical symbols that are essential to the gameplay. Below, we have the options to increase or decrease the bet value, the button to set the automatic spins and the one to rotate the reels manually. In addition to the sound of falling rocks, the background music is dominated by tribal tunes featuring flutes and drums.

Main Features

The game grid consists of five reels and four rows, with 1,024 possible ways to win, thanks to the different multipliers that can be activated during the Free Spins. The RTP is 96.2%, and the game has high volatility. The betting range is from €0.50 to €50 and players can activate from a minimum of five automatic spins up to a maximum of 999.

Symbols and Features of Aztec Wilds

The lower-paying symbols are those referring to playing cards - from 10 to Ace. After these, there are the three masks - green, red, and blue. However, the real highlight of this game are the three different Wilds:

The first is a regular Wild with the function of a Joker, which can appear on reels 2, 3, 4, and 5 and can substitute for all symbols.

The second Wild is called a "sticky" Wild and can only appear on reel 3. If the symbols underneath it disappear, it drops by one row, otherwise it covers the normal Wild function.

There is then an expanding Wild that can appear randomly on reels 2, 3, 4, and 5. By occupying the entire reel, the chances of winning combinations increase significantly.

As mentioned earlier, this game has a cascading symbol system: every winning combination makes the affected symbols disappear, replaced by new symbols that could also be winning. Every time this happens, the sculpture beside the frame is crossed by lava, highlighting a part of it. With four consecutive combinations, Free Spins are activated. During the Free Spins, after four wins, a progressive multiplier is activated, which can reach a maximum of 6X. 

Overall, Aztec Wilds provides an immersive gaming experience for experienced gamblers with a love for ancient civilizations and a taste for something unique.

Let's face it, the theme of ancient civilizations is one of the most successful in the world of slot machines, especially when it comes to the Aztec civilization. This South American culture shrouded in mystery due to their human sacrifices to the gods, has long been the stuff of legends. But there is another reason why the Aztecs have captured the imagination of so many - their wealth and hidden treasures that the greatest explorers have sought in vain for centuries.

Unlike many other slots dedicated to this topic, Iron Dog Studio's Aztec Wilds has a highly polished graphics standard, as we have come to expect from this software house in its previous works. Moreover, its gameplay system is far from the standard, with unique features that distinguish it from the majority of slots.

The game grid is framed in stone, and the brightly colored symbols are etched onto square rocks. On either side are two circular-shaped sculptures representing magical symbols that are essential to the gameplay. Below, we have the options to increase or decrease the bet value, the button to set the automatic spins and the one to rotate the reels manually. In addition to the sound of falling rocks, the background music is dominated by tribal tunes featuring flutes and drums.

Main Features

The game grid consists of five reels and four rows, with 1,024 possible ways to win, thanks to the different multipliers that can be activated during the Free Spins. The RTP is 96.2%, and the game has high volatility. The betting range is from €0.50 to €50 and players can activate from a minimum of five automatic spins up to a maximum of 999.

Symbols and Features of Aztec Wilds

The lower-paying symbols are those referring to playing cards - from 10 to Ace. After these, there are the three masks - green, red, and blue. However, the real highlight of this game are the three different Wilds:

The first is a regular Wild with the function of a Joker, which can appear on reels 2, 3, 4, and 5 and can substitute for all symbols.

The second Wild is called a "sticky" Wild and can only appear on reel 3. If the symbols underneath it disappear, it drops by one row, otherwise it covers the normal Wild function.

There is then an expanding Wild that can appear randomly on reels 2, 3, 4, and 5. By occupying the entire reel, the chances of winning combinations increase significantly.

As mentioned earlier, this game has a cascading symbol system: every winning combination makes the affected symbols disappear, replaced by new symbols that could also be winning. Every time this happens, the sculpture beside the frame is crossed by lava, highlighting a part of it. With four consecutive combinations, Free Spins are activated. During the Free Spins, after four wins, a progressive multiplier is activated, which can reach a maximum of 6X. 

Overall, Aztec Wilds provides an immersive gaming experience for experienced gamblers with a love for ancient civilizations and a taste for something unique.

Review:
 
Gameplay and Layout

Aztec Wilds has a highly polished graphics standard and a unique gameplay system. The game grid consists of five reels and four rows, with 1,024 possible ways to win. The game has a cascading symbol system that replaces every winning combination with new symbols that could also be winning. If four consecutive combinations are achieved, Free Spins are activated. The game allows players to bet from a minimum of €0.50 to a maximum of €50.

Wild Symbols

Aztec Wilds has three different Wilds, which are the highlight of this game. The first is a regular Wild with the function of a Joker that can appear on reels 2, 3, 4, and 5, and can substitute for all symbols. The second Wild is called a 'sticky' Wild and can only appear on reel 3. If the symbols underneath it disappear, it drops by one row. The last Wild is an expanding Wild that can appear randomly on reels 2, 3, 4, and 5, occupying the entire reel and increasing the chances of winning combinations.

Cascading Symbols and Free Spins

Aztec Wilds has a cascading symbol system that replaces every winning combination with new symbols that could also be winning. If four consecutive combinations are achieved, Free Spins are activated. During the Free Spins, after four wins, a progressive multiplier is activated, which can reach a maximum of 6X. The game has 1,024 possible ways to win due to the different multipliers that can be activated during the Free Spins.

Volatility and RTP

Aztec Wilds has an RTP of 96.2% and high volatility. The betting range is from €0.50 to €50 and players can activate from a minimum of five automatic spins up to a maximum of 999.

Theme and Graphics

Aztec Wilds has a theme of the ancient Aztec civilization featuring their wealth and hidden treasures. The game grid is framed in stone, and the brightly colored symbols are etched onto square rocks. On either side of the grid are two circular-shaped sculptures representing magical symbols that are essential to the gameplay. The game has highly polished graphics, and its background music is dominated by tribal tunes featuring flutes and drums.

Review: Aztec Wilds

Let's face it, the theme of ancient civilizations is one of the most successful in the world of slot machines, especially when it comes to the Aztec civilization. This South American culture shrouded in mystery due to their human sacrifices to the gods, has long been the stuff of legends. But there is another reason why the Aztecs have captured the imagination of so many - their wealth and hidden treasures that the greatest explorers have sought in vain for centuries.

Unlike many other slots dedicated to this topic, Iron Dog Studio's Aztec Wilds has a highly polished graphics standard, as we have come to expect from this software house in its previous works. Moreover, its gameplay system is far from the standard, with unique features that distinguish it from the majority of slots.

The game grid is framed in stone, and the brightly colored symbols are etched onto square rocks. On either side are two circular-shaped sculptures representing magical symbols that are essential to the gameplay. Below, we have the options to increase or decrease the bet value, the button to set the automatic spins and the one to rotate the reels manually. In addition to the sound of falling rocks, the background music is dominated by tribal tunes featuring flutes and drums.

Main Features

The game grid consists of five reels and four rows, with 1,024 possible ways to win, thanks to the different multipliers that can be activated during the Free Spins. The RTP is 96.2%, and the game has high volatility. The betting range is from €0.50 to €50 and players can activate from a minimum of five automatic spins up to a maximum of 999.

Symbols and Features of Aztec Wilds

The lower-paying symbols are those referring to playing cards - from 10 to Ace. After these, there are the three masks - green, red, and blue. However, the real highlight of this game are the three different Wilds:

The first is a regular Wild with the function of a Joker, which can appear on reels 2, 3, 4, and 5 and can substitute for all symbols.

The second Wild is called a "sticky" Wild and can only appear on reel 3. If the symbols underneath it disappear, it drops by one row, otherwise it covers the normal Wild function.

There is then an expanding Wild that can appear randomly on reels 2, 3, 4, and 5. By occupying the entire reel, the chances of winning combinations increase significantly.

As mentioned earlier, this game has a cascading symbol system: every winning combination makes the affected symbols disappear, replaced by new symbols that could also be winning. Every time this happens, the sculpture beside the frame is crossed by lava, highlighting a part of it. With four consecutive combinations, Free Spins are activated. During the Free Spins, after four wins, a progressive multiplier is activated, which can reach a maximum of 6X. 

Overall, Aztec Wilds provides an immersive gaming experience for experienced gamblers with a love for ancient civilizations and a taste for something unique.
